metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3200 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
mod_auth in lighttpd before 1.4.36 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary log entries via a basic HTTP authentication string without a colon character, as demonstrated by a string containing a NULL and new line character.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-authn-gssapi - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-authn-pam - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-authn-sasl - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-deflate - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-geoip - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-maxminddb - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-mbedtls - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-nss - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-openssl - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-trigger-b4-dl - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-vhostdb-pgsql - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-mod-wolfssl - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-modules-dbi - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-modules-ldap - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-modules-lua - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
lighttpd-modules-mysql - 1.4.45-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.45-1ubuntu3').
